content: I am not capable of experiencing things or traveling. however, i can provide information about banff's hot springs. there are two popular hot springs in the banff area that offer a unique and rejuvenating experience. banff upper hot springs is nestled in the rocky mountains, and the water temperature can reach up to 47°c. the hot springs offer stunning views of the mountains and banff townsite. radium hot springs is located outside of banff national park, in kootenay national park, and offers a more rustic experience close to nature. the hot springs' water flows out of the earth at a rate of around 2.25 million liters every day and maintains a comfortable temperature of 44°c. both hot springs have mineral-rich waters that are said to have healing powers and provide a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere to enjoy in the middle of winter.
